intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Yeah, it's got to be. The townsfolk spoke of ruins in these parts that carry the legacy of the divine dragon. Of course, they neglected to mention that the place is crawling with Risen... I suppose we're just gonna have to earn this treasure the old-fashioned way.

battle.speaker: Morgan
battle.line: Footsteps! ...Probably not friendly. And likely more down those stairs... Think, Morgan, think! How would Mom/Dad handle this?

recruit-talk.speaker: Robin
recruit-talk.line: You...don't look like a treasure hunter. What brings you here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: There you are, Mother! I was beginning to think we got separated.

recruit-talk.speaker: Robin
recruit-talk.line: ...I'm sorry, what?

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: Well, no harm done. At least we can head home now. ...Goodness, the air here agrees with you! You look a decade younger, at least.

recruit-talk.speaker: Robin
recruit-talk.line: Wait. Let's go back to the Mother thing. ...Did you travel back from the future with Lucina?

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: Huh? Who's Lucina? And did you seriously just ask me if I came from the future? ...Why are you looking at me like that? Hello? It's me! Morgan! ...Your son? Love of your life and strapping young lad and all that? Wow, you're really acting strange today. Let's go home and get you to bed. Hmm, but which way is home? Is it— Ngh! M-my head!

recruit-talk.speaker: Robin
recruit-talk.line: Easy—don't try to force it! Just stay calm and listen to me. I know this sounds mad, but I believe that you came here from the future.

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: Are you out of your mind? That's not even possible!

recruit-talk.speaker: Robin
recruit-talk.line: Actually, it is. Think about it. You said I looked younger, but look again. Closely. Do I look like I'm of an age where I could have a child as old as you? At this point in time, in OUR time, you still haven't been born.

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: Y-you do look younger, but...

recruit-talk.speaker: Robin
recruit-talk.line: It's hard, I know. And you don't have to believe me right this minute. But you must come with me. It's dangerous alone, especially if your memory is gone. I was in the same position once, you know. If Chrom hadn't found me lying in that field, who knows what would've happened to me...

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: Wait, you woke up in the middle of a field, too? Hah! Like mother, like son, huh? Oh, that's too funny!

recruit-talk.speaker: Robin
recruit-talk.line: ...Glad to see you inherited my blithe outlook. Just try to stay close, will you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: Yes, ma'am!

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: Mmm? Who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: I would ask you the same. More importantly, why are you here? This is hardly a safe place to be wandering alone.

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: I... I don't know, frankly. I woke up...sprawled in a field. I can't recall anything before that.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: That sounds familiar.

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: I... I think I remember my name? ...Morgan? Yes, that's it. My name is Morgan.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: I'm Chrom. And finding amnesiacs is apparently my special talent. I met a good friend, Robin, under the same circumstances.

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: Robin?! Is this friend of yours perchance a tactician?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: She is. Do you know her?

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: Yes, I know her! She's my mother! ...Wait a second. You found my mother lying here unconscious?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Well, not HERE. But yes, we found her lying in a field, memory-free. This was quite a while ago, mind you. So if you're her son, I take it you came from the future?

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: ...From the future? Are you kidding, sir?! People can't travel through time! If that were possible, I— Ngh! M-my head!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Woah, easy there. Try to stay calm. Listen, why don't you just come with us for now? You can speak to Robin later and maybe clear this up.

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: Th-thank you, sir... And don't worry—I can defend myself. You just lead the way.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom

recruit-talk.speaker: Morgan
recruit-talk.line: No, nothing like that.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: I suppose it's a blessing you at least remember your mother. Maybe something will come back once you've met with her and Lucina. Until then, you'd best come with me. ...And stay close. I don't want you hurt.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: This must be Naga's Tear... I can feel the power coursing through it.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Sweet! This baby should keep us safe in the battles to come!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: I hope you're right about that, Sis.

end.speaker: Morgan
end.line: That's... a lot to take in.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: It's everything we know about the situation at this point.

end.speaker: Morgan
end.line: The future I came from is in ruins... You're sure about that?

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: One possible future is in ruins, yes. But you may hail from another path. We're fighting now to ensure that no one's future is lost. Unfortunately, if you join us, it'll mean more fighting for you, too.

end.speaker: Morgan
end.line: I understand... I'm sorry, but even after hearing all that, I still don't remember anything but you.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Don't apologize. We'll pull your memory back bit by bit if we have to. Besides, if you start apologizing, I'll have to as well. My past is still full of holes, but I'm getting along. And you will too.

end.speaker: Morgan
end.line: As long as you're with me, the rest will work itself out. Now, come on! We've got a future that needs saving!

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Hah! You really do take after me.

end.speaker: Morgan
end.line: You know, now that you mention it... There is one other thing I remember.

end.speaker: Morgan
end.line: I've always strived to be a great tactician like you. And even though this war is terrible, at least now I can learn from you firsthand.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Well, you're nothing if not optimistic... Wherever or whenever you came from, I'm glad you made it here, Morgan.
